result.execSummary:
The defendant James Dafonta Reed was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all costs, fees and surcharges by 11-05-2015 or civil judgment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James Dafonta Reed

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant James Dafonta Reed in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Sentencing proceeded. Statements by parties. 
Court sentences defendant to serve 5 days in the House of Correction with credit for 5 days, a TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.  Court orders defendant to pay all costs, fees and surcharges by 11-05-2015 or civil judgement.  Appeal rights given. 

Filed: Pretrial Incarceration Credit
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant James Dafonta Reed in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 46. jks  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 05-05-2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION including drug testing.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant James Dafonta Reed in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant James Dafonta Reed in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Branch 46.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
